meanings.definition: A section or part of a larger area that has been divided into smaller parts
meanings.sent1: The city's new subdivision includes many small neighborhoods.
meanings.sent2: The subdivision of the land into plots made it easier for families to build homes.
meanings.sent3: The subdivision of the cake into tiny slices caused a frenzy at the party.
meanings.sent4: The subdivision of responsibilities among team members led to efficient collaboration.
meanings.sent5: The subdivision of the puzzle into pieces made it challenging to solve.

meanings.definition: The act of dividing something into smaller parts
meanings.sent1: The subdivision of tasks among the group members helped them work faster.
meanings.sent2: Careful subdivision of the budget ensured each department received adequate funds.
meanings.sent3: The subdivision of the chocolate bar into squares made sharing easier.
meanings.sent4: The subdivision of the book into chapters made it easier to follow the story.
meanings.sent5: The subdivision of the music into different genres catered to diverse tastes.

meanings.definition: A housing development consisting of houses built close together on a piece of land
meanings.sent1: The new subdivision is a vibrant community with modern homes.
meanings.sent2: Living in a subdivision offers a sense of community and shared spaces.
meanings.sent3: The subdivision's strict rules about lawn maintenance caused some humorous disputes.
meanings.sent4: The subdivision of the neighborhood into smaller units created a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The subdivision's playground is a popular spot for children to play.
